item.title: publications
item.description: 2019 Veale M. & Brass I. (2019) Administration by Algorithm? Public Management meets Public Sector Machine Learning. In: Algorithmic Regulation (K Yeung & M Lodge eds., Oxford University Press). Delacroix S. & Veale M. (2019) Smart Technologies and Our Sense of Self: Going Beyond Epistemic Counter-Profiling. In: Law and Life in the Era of Data-Driven Agency (K O’Hara & M Hildebrandt eds., Edward Elgar). 2018 Veale M.

item.title: talks
item.description: “Explainable Machine Learning is Often More Complex and Less Helpful Than You Might Think: Lessons from the Law, Lab and the Office”, keynote at Explainable AI — Transparency and Accountability in a Data-Driven Society, Aarhus University, 8 April 2019. “Responsible Machine Learning and EU Data Protection Law”, Privacy, Power & Ethics Conference, Institute for Privacy Protection, Seton Hall Law School, New Jersey, 4-5 April 2019. “Insecurity by Design in Real Time Bidding”, Information Commissioner’s Office AdTech Fact Finding Forum, London, 6 March 2019.

item.title: New data protection by design paper
